attributes.action: end the binding civil judgments of Beth Din and Sharia courts in Britain.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Courts in England should have universal rules for all citizens independent of the religious views of those citizens.  Jew, Muslim and Christian should be treated the same as all other faiths and those of no faith in our legal system.  No religious court should be enforceable by civil law.

rejection.details: Shari'a law is not part of the law. People can abide by religious laws if they wish to do so, but no decision made by any body other than a Magistrates or Crown Court can be recognised as legally binding.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
